history.narrative: Law 17-26, the “Election Day Amendment Act of 2007”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 17-169 which was referred to the Committee on Public Safety and Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 5, 2007, and July 10, 2007, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 25, 2007, it was assigned Act No. 17-88 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 17-26 became effective on October 18, 2007.
